dotInsights | June 2025

Did you know? The Original Name of .NET Was ‚ÄúNext Generation Windows Services (NGWS)‚Äú. Before Microsoft officially named it ‚Äú.NET,‚Äù the platform was internally referred to as NGWS: Next Generation Windows Services. The name ‚Äú.NET‚Äù was adopted in the late 1990s to emphasize the platform‚Äôs focus on web-based development and interoperability, as opposed to being tightly coupled to Windows-specific services.
